page.title: 04LARGE-SCALE FARMING
page.content:
One landowner farms almost 3,000 acres in and around Reasby. It is an arable farm growing only winter-sown wheat and barley. Corn has been grown continuously without a break crop for the past 15 years. The soil is tested regularly.
The harvested corn is sold for milling and animal feed, none is grown for malting. An average yield is 2.75 tons per acre. To ensure high yields fertilizer is applied every 2 years at an average cost of Â£36 per acre.
Ten men are employed, some of whom live in tied houses. Arable farming is less labour intensive than livestock farming, here averaging one man to 360 acres.
